Agree that they need to be identified but they have broken the laws and have to pay for that if eligible to stay...  They enjoy so much more freedom in this country and a chance for a prosperous life that they never could have realized in their native Mexico, Bulgaria, Scotland, Uganda or wherever on earth they're from...

“Prudence, compassion and thrift all point us toward the same goal: bringing these workers out of the shadows and into becoming and being taxpaying members of society."
Becoming? These people are already taxpayers. Even if illegal, many use false documents and pay income and social security taxes. Not for identity theft or other nefarious reasons, but just to survive on a tough planet. They never collect any of the social security they pay into and they sure as heck don't apply for income tax refunds! Free money for the rest of the country.
Homeowners pay real estate taxes regardless of immigration status. And of course if anyone rents, they indirectly pay real estate taxes as well.
Sales taxes? No brainer.
So folks who are here without the proper documents pay the taxes, do the work no one else wants, and aren't eligible for the benefits. It almost feels like an argument to leave things as they are, since the country is getting a good deal. Unfortunately it is a deal with the devil, in that it totally takes advantage of vulnerable people who are our neighbors.
So let's get on with it and find a way for people to become full participants in our society who already live and work and pay taxes among us and contribute to our economy.

A hundred thumbs up for this post.  Watch for the quid-pro-quo.  Republicans don't do anything for anyone without there being a payoff in it for them.  It simply isn't in the party DNA to do  the right thing simply because it is the right thing to do...for the people, for the country, for humanity.

Agreed that it's a pretty cynical and transparent move, but it is a move nonetheless.  These are the kinds of calculations that result in things being done.  If you take the politicians who genuinely care about those who cook their food, mow their lawns, build their houses and provide service in a variety of business while being exploited and then take other who are calculating that perpetually demonizing the Hispanic and immigrant population is a bad call THEN you can get something done.  Those who truly care alone can't pass legislation.
Our country is not Christian nor is it a home for low skilled Latinos. It's rather horrifying that you apparently believe otherwise.

Compassion for the poor didn't change their mind. Christ saying we must care for the starnger amonst us didn't change their mind. Helping immigrants in a nation of immigrants didn't change their mind. Love for our Hispanic brothers and sisters in Christ didn't change their mind. Loving our neighbor as Christ commanded didn't change their mind. The growth of the Hispanic population didn't change their mind . . . UNTIL it cost them an election. Suddenly the prospect of Not Being Re-Elected put the Fear of God in them. Hardly the parable of the Good Samaritan. Mostly the 'What's In It For ME ? Parable. Me FIRST ! Gimme ! Gimme ! Gimme ! Until there is something tangible in it for them Republicans have no concern, see no moral duty. After Bush & Cheney, I am Not Surprised ! Are You ?

"Another View" misunderstands the current situation when he writes "Most of these people cannot make ends meet without social services and will depend on these programs to survive." We are talking about millions of people who live and work in this country right now. They are not eligible to apply for any social services and do not receive any now. Why would they suddenly lose the ability to make ends meet because they become legal workers? On the contrary, the will be less likely to be abused and underpaid by employers and are like improve their economic conditions.
I am with you 100%!!!

Carl, you haven't been paying attention...

That may be technically true, but it is effectively false since once an illegal alien bears a child here, the family is then eligible for food stamps, WIC, health care (including dental), section 8 vouchers, etc. Talk to illegal aliens and those who work with them to learn that many have figured out this work around to tap into public benefits. It also helps if the mother of the child is "single". But no one keeps track that the father is living with the family.

It is true that many illegal aliens are hard-working, but the taxpayer is subsidizing many of the necessities of living in this country. A significant part of their earnings (which are, for millions of illegal aliens, untaxed monies paid under the table by unscrupulous employers) is then free to be sent to their home countries to support extended families.

This is not sustainable.

I am no fan of the Republicans, but the notion that illegal aliens are not receiving public benefits is completely false.

It has nothing to do with being nice... It has nothing to do with wooing Hispanic voters... The reason the Republicans may allow the 25+ million illegal aliens and all their family members through subsequent chain migration (the 11 million is a woeful undercount) to have "a pathway to citizenship" is to further their greater goals of eliminating all social programs like Social Security, Medicare, Medicaid, food stamps, etc. Many of these people cannot make ends meet without social services and will depend on these programs to survive. But the taxpayers will not be able to sustain the ballooning costs and, in effect, this mass amnesty would create a Trojan Piñata that would strain all social services to the point of collapse. Then, fiscally, the country would have no choice but to eliminate them and the Republicans will have reached their ultimate goal. Clever...

The world is full of good people who want to improve their lot, but the American taxpayer cannot afford to subsidize unlimited numbers of them.

Don't take the bait and give in to the "inevitability" of amnesty. Call your reps and senators and tell them not to support it.

Republicans wanted the illegal here because he could be intimidated, and driven to below minimum wage jobs, and cheated and used and robbed.  Then the economy went sour, and they wanted to make them choose to return back from wherever they came because they were no longer needed.  Deny the immigrant basic subsistence, amke the choose to return was the mantra.  Let'm starve, The Compassionate Conservative way to get rid of the illegals.

While I honor your service, you should be aware that all Americans who are legal American citizens are equally considered American citizens. You service does not make you more American than anyone else.

SHAME ON YOU. I say this as a US Marine who is outraged at what i have come home to see. Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid has decided that a proposed assault weapons ban won't be part of a gun control bill the Senate plans to debate next month, a decision that means the ban stands little chance of survival.

Instead, Sen. Dianne Feinstein said she will be able to offer her ban on the military-style firearms as an amendment. Feinstein is all but certain to need 60 votes from the 100-member Senate to prevail, but she faces solid Republican/Tea Party opposition and likely defections from some moderate Democrats.

At least she tried and gave it her best effort.

Many Democrats think the ban on large-capacity magazines has a better chance of getting 60 votes than the assault weapons ban.

Anti-gun violence supporters consider a strong Senate vote important because the Republican/Tea Party-controlled House has shown little enthusiasm for most of President Obama's proposals.
You skipped over the phrase "well regulated".
How about we focus on getting the mentally deranged off the streets, and leave the guns alone.

I'm not sure I buy it entirely, as I don't have time to chase down the primary sources, but it's interesting nevertheless.

Wow that is... some seriously wishful thinking there. You may think that the military is made up of a huge majority of people that fit your rather thorough narrative. It does not.

You see, your rationale can be used both ways.

Here in Texas, I have to run a transfer of my automobile through the state, even if the sale is to my brother or my neighbor. Why shouldn't private gun sales be treated in the same way? What is the objection?

And just what is the source of your data?  With close to one thousand shootings  a month since Newtown, someone has to be pulling the trigger.  As one of the commenters said, guns don't shoot themselves.

Read the NFA. Fully automatic machine guns and assault rifles are LEGAL to own in more than 30 states. You must pass a stringent background check and pay a $200 tax on the transfer of such guns. They are also extremely expensive. A Thompson submachine gun costs upwards of $15,000. So please don't post if you don't know what you're talking about.

John Cope: You don't know too much about our form of government do you!I'm surprised, since you live in the home of the father of our country. America is not a true democracy John. It's a democratic republic. There is a big difference. If it were a true democracy, you would be able to hear liberals howling from the planet Venus. Why? Because in a true democracy, there would be no Obamacare! There would be no gay marriage and no electoral college to elect presidents. The Keystone pipeline would have been built years ago. Dozens of other things that liberals hate would be happening, and dozens of things they like would not be happening. You see John, or founding fathers understood that the majority isn't always right, and the minority isn't always wrong. A democratic republic protects the rights of the 49% from being trampled by the rights of the 51%. That's pretty much what is happening in our country right now. The founding fathers realized that huge majorities better reflected the will of the people. That is why Obama does not have the mandate that he thinks he does, and that is why it takes a 2/3's majority of both houses and ratification by 38 states, to amend or repeal any part of the constitution. Do you understand now, John.

You lost the argument to ban semi-automatic weapons! Get over it.

The Bill of Rights was designed to protect the rights of everyone from government actions, be these actions supported or not by a majority of citizens. The US was created, and, fundamentally, still is a Republic, not a regime in which decisions are made by acclamation. This latter type of regime is what the Greeks used to call mob rule, and is much closer to fascism than to democracy.

The US Constitution clearly states what the proper procedure is for it to be amended. If you want to repeal the Second Amendment, follow this procedure, and stop trying to bully legislators and public opinion by invoking the supposed wishes of a hypothetical majority.

This is an outrage and a subversion of true democracy. If you counted the number of voters in this country who want to seriously limit guns and get rid of machine guns (assault weapons) from being available to the public they would definitely outnumber those who do not want any restrictions. The whole 2nd amendment thing is ridiculous. It is an outdated amendment, period, no matter what the interpretation may be. What good is the congress if they don't vote what the people who elected them want? The whole congress is coopted by big money and lobbyists.

Martin, it's irrelevant that the man didn't harm anyone. Why is it on the public to hope that the guy with the large weapon isn't going to ruin their bike ride? It's selfish. We shouldn't abandon the social contract to appease a few radicals.
3000 people died in 911 and it was a national tragedy. 30,000 people die every year from fire arms and its not worthy topic for discussion.

Do you honestly beleive that the criminals are going to adhere to a mag capacity limit?????

THEY SURE AS HECK WON'T!

And neither will I.

How do you know gun laws won't work?  How do you know they won't prevent the next tragedy?  You need only look at the states that have more restrictive gun laws and compare their gun death rates to those states that have less restrictive laws to see that laws restricting guns do have some effect on the incidence on gun violence.  Let's base our arguments on reality and not on some vague notion that you have to support your pro-gun agenda.

Denru points out a little-known fact about American history that unwittingly undermines his argument: weapon control laws were the norm through all of American history. The claimed individual right to gun ownership is a recent invention.

Gun control laws successfully kept machine gun violence throughout the mid-20th century. Gun control laws were used throughout the Old West.

You right-wingers have invented a mythical history and are attempting to force us all to live in it.
The NRA is largely funded by firearms manufacturers. It's their PR/lobbying organization.

The NRA is a nonprofit organization, just like the AARP, the NAACP, and NPR.

Why didn't the gun laws of yesteryear work? What will these new gun laws solve? How will they prevent the next tragedy? They won't. Each new gun law promises to fix a problem, and each new law is now more necessary than the last. Gun laws don't work because criminals do not obey them.

The Republicans don't want foreseeable citizenship for those who will vote Democratic.   The Democrats don't want to bar them forever.   The Catch-22 is the Republican making real closing of the border the precondition, which is impossible without changes no one is talking about--federal IDs, real penalties on employers, amendment of the XIV Amendment, etc..    A sound bet is that the parties will use this to prevent agreement.

Martin, it is only Wednesday.  There is no need to retire until Sunday and even then this is not a game between you and me.  Besides, if you retire, I will only add that even Martin can't get it and the seal will return.
The only barrier to Iran was the corrupt regime of Saddam. Bush and the Neo cons got of him and we had no buffer to Iran, and now Iran sides with Iraq.  The enemy you know...........

Read or reread Rajiv Chandrasekaran's marvelous book - "Imperial Life in the Emerald City." Also - Anthony Shadid's "Night Draws Near." Shadid was already in Iraq when the bombing started. He spoke fluent Arabic, so had connections and understanding not available to most other reporters.

Also, we should not forget that by the invasion 10 years ago Iraq had been seriously weakened and impoverished by the no-fly zone and sanctions of the Bush I and Clinton eras - 1990 to 2003.

"Mission Accomplished" said GWB before the American public began to get a clue of the unfolding disaster.
